0.title: Zomato app down for several users across India
0.article_body: Several users of the food delivery app Zomato from different cities, including Delhi, Bengaluru and Mumbai, took to Twitter on Sunday claiming that the app is down. The app showed a message that read, "We're not accepting orders online. We'll be back soon." According to Downdetector, a spurt in outage was reported by Zomato users from 7:30 pm onwards.

1.title: Video shows Zomato delivery man & Noida society guard hitting each other with sticks
1.article_body: A video has surfaced online which shows a Zomato delivery man and a housing society guard in Noida kicking, punching and hitting each other with sticks. Police said that the fight broke out after the security guard did not allow the delivery man to enter the society. "Both of them have been arrested under section 151 of IPC," police added.

2.title: Why should a transgender play role of transgender: Gauri Sawant on 'Taali'
2.article_body: Transgender activist Gauri Sawant, reacting to conversation on social media around transgender actors not being considered for her role in 'Taali', said, "Why should a transgender play role of transgender?" "People should consider us for other roles," she said, adding, "I did an [ad] where I played...a mother, and people accepted me...Why should [we] be restricted to just...transgender roles?"

3.title: People of Gujarat have blessed me without looking at my caste: PM Modi
3.article_body: Addressing a public rally in Mehsana ahead of the upcoming state Assembly polls, PM Narendra Modi said that the people of Gujarat have blessed him for the last two decades without looking at his caste. "[People blessed me] without looking at my political background," PM Modi said. Notably, PM Modi was the CM of Gujarat between 2001 and 2014.

4.title: No material impact of rate hike on demand for home loans: RBI data
4.article_body: Interest rates don't seem to have a material impact on people seeking home loans as home loan outstanding of banks almost doubled to ₹16.84 lakh crore in last five years, RBI data showed. Banks' housing loan outstanding rose between 13.7-16.4% YoY in FY23's first five months. In the same period, RBI hiked the interest rate thrice by 140 basis points.

5.title: Tej Pratap Yadav leaves RJD meeting midway, says party leader abused him & his sister
5.article_body: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son and Bihar Cabinet Minister Tej Pratap Yadav left the national executive meeting midway and accused party leader Shyam Rajak of abusing him and his sister. He also accused Rajak of being an RSS agent. "A powerful person has right to say whatever he wants...I am from Dalit community. I cannot say anything," Rajak said.

6.title: Formulate regulations to check growth of 'Instagram influencers': HC to Centre
6.article_body: Karnataka High Court has advised the Centre to formulate regulatory measures to check the growth of "pseudo-therapists" and "Instagram influencers". "On social media, therapists pose as if they are in the field of therapy. It is also in public domain that they are pseudo-therapists who are Instagram influencers...In reality, they aren't bound by ethics or regulated by norms," HC said.

7.title: It's not our study material: BYJU'S on incorrect Indian map with 'Azad Kashmir'
7.article_body: BYJU'S has denied that the viral image of an incorrect Indian map bearing the company's name and 'Azad Kashmir' marking wasn't a part of the company's study material. "This is a fake image and not our material," BYJU'S said in a statement. "We strongly condemn the incorrect map of India that's being distributed maliciously with our incorrect logo," it added.

8.title: We've been absolutely on it: Verstappen on defending F1 world c'ship title
8.article_body: After winning the Formula One world championship title for the second consecutive year, Red Bull's Max Verstappen tweeted, "We've been absolutely on it, the whole year." He added, "A season where we had a difficult start but kept it cool, bounced back and never let go." Verstappen clinched the title after winning the Japanese Grand Prix on Sunday.

9.title: Microplastics found in human breast milk for the first time
9.article_body: Microplastics have been found in human breast milk for the first time, according to a research published in the peer-reviewed journal Polymers. An Italian team of researchers took breast milk samples from 34 healthy mothers a week after giving birth and microplastics were detected in 75% of them. The researchers found microplastics composed of polyethylene, PVC and polypropylene.

10.title: Casillas tweets 'I'm gay', Puyol responds 'Time to tell our story'; both delete tweets later
10.article_body: Ex-Spain captain and goalkeeper Iker Casillas on Sunday posted a tweet in Spanish that translated to "I hope you respect me: I'm gay". Responding to his tweet, his ex-Spain teammate Carles Puyol wrote, "The time has come to tell our story...Iker." However, the duo, who were rivals during their time at Barcelona and Real Madrid respectively, deleted their tweets later.

11.title: 1,000 electric vehicles' charging points set up across Delhi: Govt
11.article_body: Delhi government has set up 1,000 electric vehicles' charging points in less than a year under the single window facility. "It's just...beginning as Delhi plans to install 18,000 charging points in...next three years," Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said. "By 2024-end, Delhi is determined to have one out of every four new vehicles purchased to be an electric vehicle," he added.

12.title: PM Modi inaugurates 3D light & sound show in Gujarat's Sun Temple
12.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 3D projection light and sound show explaining the importance of the Sun Temple in Gujarat's Modhera on Sunday. He declared Modhera village in Mehsana district India's first 24x7 solar-powered village. "Modhera was known for Sun Temple and now it will also be known as a solar-powered village," PM Modi said.

13.title: India could get chunk of €300 billion fund under EU scheme: French envoy
13.article_body: French Ambassador Emmanuel Lenain said India could receive a chunk of the €300 billion (₹24.21 lakh crore) fund announced by the European Union under its Global Gateway scheme. Lenain said Paris does not want to be "confrontational" but prefers to be "efficient" for the Indo-French convergence. Lenain also said there is a need for an "alternative to the Chinese model".

14.title: Government to commence FY24 budget making exercise on Monday
14.article_body: The government will begin its annual Budget making exercise for financial year 2023-24 on Monday. The meeting would start with consultations with various ministries and departments on the revised estimates (RE) of expenditure for ongoing financial year and the fund requirement for 2023-24. Most of these discussions would be chaired by the Finance Secretary and Expenditure Secretary.

15.title: VIPs caught having alcohol to be kept in special cell with AC in dry Bihar
15.article_body: A special ward has been set up for VIPs caught consuming alcohol in the Samastipur area of Bihar, where liquor is banned. Excise Superintendent SK Chaudhary said a trained dog will also be kept in the special cell for their safety. The special cell will have two beds, air conditioners, a sofa and a table among other amenities.

16.title: We've not come Himachal to sit, but to change its destiny: Nadda
16.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda has said that BJP has come to Himachal Pradesh to change the destiny of the state. He said, "Elected representatives are sitting here...We've not come here to sit on our seats, we've come to change the image and destiny of Himachal." Earlier, Nadda had said BJP is the only ideology-based and national party in India.

17.title: Puducherry LG is running a parallel govt: AIADMK
17.article_body: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan was criticised by the AIADMK for "running a parallel government" in the Union Territory. Puducherry's AIADMK East Wing convenor A Anbalagan called the LG's open house session to accept petitions from public an "insult to the elected government". The LG had said that people could meet her at Raj Nivas after seeking prior appointment.

18.title: Gandhi family is blessing me, Kharge ji: Tharoor
18.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Shashi Tharoor said that the Gandhi family is blessing him and his opponent Mallikarjun Kharge as well because they are "contesting" for making the Congress party stronger. "My interactions with the Gandhi family have convinced me that there is no bias from them towards either me or Kharge," Tharoor said.

19.title: Was surprised: Pankaj on Election Commission making him national icon
19.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi revealed he was surprised after he was named the national icon by the Election Commission of India. Pankaj added the Election Commission noticed that he's eager to take forward "the message of the importance of democracy". "It's for the love of democracy which has pushed me to contribute and it was acknowledged with the tag," he stated.

20.title: Govt buys 60% more from small businesses in first half of FY23 from year-ago period
20.article_body: According to government data, central public sector enterprises (CPSEs) bought goods worth 60% more from micro and small enterprises (MSEs) in first half of 2022-23 as compared to same period last year. The total amount of public procurement by CPSEs stands at ₹21,256 crore as of October 9. According to the data, procurement was made from 75,120 MSEs this year.

21.title: Banks financing Twitter deal face $500 million in losses: Report
21.article_body: According to a report, several major US and foreign banks could suffer losses of $500 million or more if they financed Elon Musk's $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. Lenders, led by Morgan Stanley and including Barclays and Bank of America, committed to provide $13 billion of debt financing for the deal. Banks agreed to terms with lower returns in April.

22.title: Multiple landslides disrupt road connectivity between Sikkim & Bengal
22.article_body: Heavy rain early on Sunday triggered multiple landslides in Sikkim, which cut off road connectivity between the Northeastern state and West Bengal. Huge boulders have blocked National Highway 10 at two places between Singtam and Rangpo in East Sikkim, an official said. "It may take an entire day to clear the debris and reopen the way for traffic," he added.

23.title: Foreign investors invest ₹2,400 crore in Indian equities in first week of October
23.article_body: According to data from the depositories, foreign portfolio investors (FPI) have invested a net ₹2,440 crore in the domestic equity markets in the first week of October. FPI flow is expected to remain volatile in the coming months on a slew of global and domestic factors, experts said. FPIs had withdrawn over ₹7,600 crore last month.

24.title: India, UAE can benefit from increasing cooperation in different sectors: Report
24.article_body: A Deloitte report said India's and the UAE's economies can benefit significantly from their free trade agreement by sharing knowledge and practices in areas of mutual interest like education, energy and defence. Both countries implemented the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) from May 1. According to the report, UAE has committed to meet India's energy needs at competitive rates.

25.title: TV show director told me, 'TV is about tall, thin, fair girl': Malishka
25.article_body: RJ Malishka Mendonsa opened up about how she overcame her insecurities with body image. "It takes a lot of self-talk, it takes a lot of friends...it takes you trusting yourself eventually...you've to make yourself realize...these are self-imposed doubts," she stated. Malishka said, "One of...directors of a TV show...told me...'Television is all about tall, thin, fair, straight-hair girls'."

26.title: Bowling in nets to class players helped me: Bracewell after NZ's win
26.article_body: Following New Zealand's eight-wicket win over Bangladesh in the tri-series, New Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', said he's happy with his effort. "The experience of bowling to some class players at the nets helped me, it was challenging at times, but exciting as well," he added. Bracewell posted bowling figures of 4-0-14-2.

27.title: US says failed rocket attack targeted its troops in Syria
27.article_body: A rocket fired at a compound in Syria hosting US troops and partnered local forces on Saturday failed to cause any injuries or damage, the US military said. The 107 mm rocket failed to impact anything inside the Rumalyn Landing Zone US compound, it added. The military did not identify anyone who could be responsible for the failed attack.

28.title: Ambuja Cements gets shareholders' nod to raise ₹20,000 crore from Adani Group
28.article_body: Ambuja Cements said it has received shareholders' approval for all proposals in its EGM, including a resolution to raise ₹20,000 crore from Harmonia Trade and Investment, an Adani group firm. Resolutions to appoint Gautam Adani, his son Karan Adani and two directors and four independent directors on the board of Ambuja Cements were also approved by the shareholders.

29.title: Nissan pushing partner Renault to sell down stake, may raise funds: Reports
29.article_body: According to reports, Nissan is pushing Renault to cut its stake in Nissan to as much as 15%, and may consider raising funds to buy back the shares. The demands were made in exchange for Nissan agreeing to invest in Renault's new unit which will house its electric vehicle assets. Reports said the deal would not affect their business alliance.

30.title: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan blessed with twin boys, share pics
30.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan have been blessed with twin boys. Taking to Instagram to share pictures on behalf of him and Nayanthara, Vignesh revealed they have named the boys 'Uyir' and 'Ulagam'. "All our prayers...our ancestors' blessings combined with all the good manifestations made...have come together in the form of two blessed babies for us," he wrote.

31.title: Forceps left in Kerala woman's stomach during caesarean removed after 5 years
31.article_body: A woman in Kerala has registered a complaint against doctors for leaving forceps inside her body while performing caesarean surgery on her five years ago. Harshina had undergone surgery at Kozhikode Medical College after she began feeling "severe pain". A CT scan revealed there was a metal object in her stomach that was poking at her urinary bladder, causing infection.

32.title: You don't get these type of players daily: Warner on Tim David
32.article_body: Opening batter David Warner said that the Singapore-born Tim David is a "godsend" for the Australian team. "He's an incredible player. Has some serious power, so it boosts our middle order," Warner said. The 35-year-old cricketer added, "You don't get these type of players every day. So it's going to be good for us moving forward."

33.title: Owaisi shares portrait of Tipu in Constitution, says 'Our founders knew more'
33.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday shared a picture of the Constitution of India with Tipu Sultan's portrait in it, saying the founders of the Republic of India knew "more than mercy-petition-writers and British slaves". "I seem to have triggered too many illiterate sanghi shakha-putras with my tweet on Tipu Sultan," Owaisi wrote on Twitter.

34.title: India, Taiwan should consider finalising FTA at the earliest: Taiwanese envoy
34.article_body: Taiwan's de-facto Ambassador Baushuan Ger said that India and Taiwan should finalise the proposed free trade agreement (FTA) as soon as possible to remove barriers for trade and investment. Ger said Taiwan is keen to share its expertise with India in sectors like semiconductors, 5G, information security and AI. He reaffirmed Taipei's focus on supporting the rules-based international order.

35.title: All schools in UP's Aligarh closed till October 12 due to heavy rains
35.article_body: The district administration in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on Sunday announced that all schools till Class 12 will be closed till October 12 due to heavy rains in the past 24 hours. All schools affiliated with AMU have been asked to comply with the order. Several areas of the district were waterlogged due to the heavy rains.

36.title: Earth caves in at construction site in TN, 2 workers buried alive
36.article_body: Two construction workers were buried alive and two others managed to escape after a portion of earth caved in on them while they were working at a building construction site in Tamil Nadu on Sunday. Nilgiris District Collector, who visited the spot with senior officials, has ordered an inquiry to ascertain whether the construction work was permitted.

37.title: Jaya says Amitabh became 'active parent' after Shweta's marriage
37.article_body: Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of the podcast 'What The Hell Navya', revealed that her actor-husband Amitabh Bachchan became an "active parent" after the marriage of their daughter Shweta Bachchan. "Till then I was doing it alone, everything," she added. Shweta got married to Nikhil Nanda in 1997. 'What The Hell Navya' is hosted by Jaya's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda.

38.title: SBI lines up NPAs over ₹746 crore for sale in October and November
38.article_body: The State Bank of India has put various non-performing assets (NPAs) up for sale in October and November, including the fraud account of Sintex-BAPL, to recover over ₹746 crore. NPAs will be offered to asset reconstruction companies/financial institutions, banks or Non-Banking Financial Companies. The auction will include accounts of Sintex-BAPL, Surat Hazira NH6 Tollway and Shreebhav Polyweaves.

39.title: IDBI Bank buyers need MHA clearance in 1st stage of bidding
39.article_body: The central government has mandated that interested buyers of IDBI Bank will have to seek security clearance from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) during the first stage of the bidding process. The government and LIC will together divest a 60.72% stake in the lender. Interested parties will have to certify that no regulatory authority's investigation is pending against them.

40.title: Nitish's blind eye to corruption is shameful: Ravi Shankar Prasad
40.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said it was "shameful" and "unfortunate" how Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has "turned a blind eye to the issue of corruption". "Nitish Kumar should let the law take its course," said Prasad. He was speaking about Kumar's statement in support of RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is accused of an alleged railway land-for-job scam.

41.title: Shami will replace Bumrah in T20 WC squad: Parthiv Patel
41.article_body: Ex-cricketer Parthiv Patel said that pacer Mohammad Shami will most likely replace injured Jasprit Bumrah in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Hopefully, because we have 20 days to go and he (Shami) has almost recovered from COVID-19. Before WC, India will play two practice matches...So he will get match-time...I feel he is the frontrunner," Patel said.

42.title: It left a huge impact on me: Kichcha Sudeepa on 'Kantara'
42.article_body: Actor Kichcha Sudeepa took to social media and penned a note praising the Kannada film 'Kantara'. "We do witness films that are...fantastic. But rarely do we come across one that leaves us speechless. 'Kantara' is one such film that left a huge impact on me," he said. He also praised actor Rishab Shetty's performance in the film, calling it "fantabulous".

43.title: US' Fritz beats compatriot Tiafoe to clinch 3rd title of 2022 at Japan Open
43.article_body: American Taylor Fritz beat compatriot Frances Tiafoe 7-6(7-3), 7-6(7-2) in Japan Open Tennis Championships final to claim his third title of 2022 on Sunday. Fritz became the 10th different American singles champion at the ATP 500 event and the first since Pete Sampras in 1996. Fritz will make his Top 10 debut at number 8 in ATP rankings on Monday.

44.title: Presence of 8 leopards confirmed in Delhi's Asola Bhatti Sanctuary
44.article_body: A year-long study by Delhi's forest and wildlife department and Bombay Natural History Society has confirmed the presence of eight leopards in Delhi's Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary. The study used 42 infra-red stealth camera traps to detect presence of leopards and other mammals like striped hyena and jungle cat. Sanctuary's area bordering Chhattarpur and Neeli Jheel witnessed most sightings.

45.title: 'Vikram', 'Ponniyin...' sequels will be blockbusters in Hindi: Jayantilal
45.article_body: Producer Jayantilal Gada has predicted that 'Vikram 2' and 'Ponniyin Selvan: II' will be blockbusters in Hindi. "More and more people will watch both 'Vikram' and 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' on the OTT world until the sequel arrives," he added. "If Sita Ramam team decides to make a sequel, even that will be a success story in Hindi," he stated.

46.title: Bodies of 3 women found floating in dam in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi
46.article_body: Bodies of three women were found floating in a dam in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi, police said. It is likely that they were swept away from bordering Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district, Jhansi SSP said, adding that the bodies have been sent for postmortem. Information about the first body was received from a UP Irrigation Department employee in Mauranipur late on Saturday.

47.title: Video shows Centaurus Mall in Pakistan's Islamabad on fire
47.article_body: A massive fire broke out on the third floor of the Centaurus Mall in Pakistan's capital Islamabad on Sunday. People inside the mall were safely evacuated, Islamabad Police said. Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif tweeted, "It is very unfortunate that this incident happened...I pray that there is no loss of life. Condolences and sympathies for the financial losses of the victims."

48.title: Drop it further: Vij as Owaisi says Muslim population is on decline
48.article_body: After AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said Muslim population is on the decline, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said, "If it's so, then that's a very good thing." "Drop it further and bring it to 'hum do humare do'," Vij added. Earlier, Owaisi had said, "Don't take tension...Muslim population is not rising...Do you know who's...using condoms the most? [Muslims] are doing."

49.title: BJP trying to insult me: Rajendra Pal after resigning as Delhi Minister
49.article_body: AAP leader Rajendra Pal Gautam, who resigned from the Delhi Cabinet amid controversy over his participation in a religious conversion event, said BJP has made it an issue. He added that BJP is trying to insult him and the Aam Aadmi Party. He was criticised after participating in the event where 10,000 people converted to Buddhism.

50.title: Farmers are beaten by police, unable to get manure: Kamal Nath
50.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath said that the farmers in Madhya Pradesh are unable to get manure and instead are getting beaten by the state police. "On one hand, the farmers' soybean crop has been spoiled by the rains and on the other hand, they are getting worried about the manure," the former Madhya Pradesh CM said.

51.title: Mismatch in DNA samples does not absolve an accused: Karnataka HC
51.article_body: Karnataka HC said even if DNA samples do not match, it wouldn't absolve an accused since the submission is collaborative evidence. The court then rejected the petition of a man accused of raping and impregnating a 12-year-old girl. The man had approached the court after a DNA test showed that his blood and that of the foetus did not match.

52.title: Wasim Jaffer criticises boundary rope placement in Australia-England T20I, shares pic
52.article_body: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a picture from first Australia-England T20I in Perth and criticised the boundary rope being brought in "significantly". He wrote, "I see the boundary rope brought in significantly in the Australia-England T20I. I hope that's not the case during the T20 World Cup. Big grounds, long boundaries is what makes cricket in Australia unique."

53.title: 7 booked for kidnapping Pune businessman, demanding ₹20 crore ransom
53.article_body: Police have booked seven persons, including gangster Gajanan Marne, for allegedly kidnapping and demanding ₹20 crore ransom from a businessman in Pune. The accused also threatened to kill the businessman if he fails to give the money, police said. However, the victim was rescued by the police after they laid a trap and arrested four of the accused persons.

54.title: Thane man kills friend after fight over ₹4.5 lakh, informs police
54.article_body: A man stabbed his friend to death in Maharashtra's Kalyan after the victim was allegedly reluctant to pay back the ₹4.5 lakh loan he took from the accused. The accused then reportedly called the police and informed them about the murder. The two were said to be inebriated when the discussion on paying back the money turned violent.

55.title: PM Modi declares Gujarat's Modhera as India's first 24x7 solar-powered village
55.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday declared Modhera, a village in Gujarat's Mehsana district, as India's first 24x7 solar-powered village. PM Modi said people of Modhera need not pay for electricity anymore but can sell the electricity they generate themselves. He also inaugurated projects worth about ₹3,900 crore related to dairy, skill development and healthcare in the village.

56.title: Australia's Wade allegedly obstructs the field, Jos Buttler refuses to appeal; video viral
56.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade allegedly obstructed the field during the first T20I against England in Perth. A video has gone viral showing Wade pushing bowler Mark Wood away so that he doesn’t reach the ball for a catch while it was in the air. The umpires offered England captain Jos Buttler to appeal for the dismissal, but he refused.

57.title: FIR against Pak Navy jawans for attempting to kill Indian fishermen
57.article_body: Gujarat Police have registered an FIR against 20-25 Pakistani Navy personnel for allegedly kidnapping and attempting to kill seven Indian fishermen in the Arabian Sea. On October 6, uniformed Pakistani jawans reportedly kidnapped the fishermen after firing unprovoked on the boat fishing in Indian waters off the Jakhau coast. The fishermen were then rescued by the Indian Coast Guard.

58.title: It's overdue, frankly: iPod creator on EU forcing Apple for USB-C
58.article_body: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell has reacted to the EU's decision of having one single charger, USB-C, for all devices in 2023. "I'm not too worried about this regulation. They're simply forcing Apple to do the right thing...It's overdue, frankly," he tweeted. "They (Apple) have to put their responsibility for the planet over its shareholders," he said in another tweet.

59.title: Man fires outside Delhi store to extort ₹50 lakh from owner, video surfaces
59.article_body: A man opened fire outside a grocery store in Delhi's Dariyapur and attempted to extort ₹50 lakh from the owner, reports said. In a video of the incident, two people reached the store with their faces covered, following which one of the accused threw a note inside the shop and escaped on a bike with the other accused.

60.title: Nitish Kumar politically isolated, growing delusional: Prashant Kishor
60.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor claimed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar was feeling "politically isolated, after being surrounded by people whom he did not trust". "Slowly, age seems to be catching up...and he seems to be growing delusional," said Kishor. Refuting Kumar's claims that he's working for the BJP, Kishor asked why then would he suggest moves to "strengthen the Congress".

61.title: Housing societies' representatives walk out of PCMC session
61.article_body: Housing societies' representatives walked out from a Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) session on wet waste disposal due to the absence of civic officials. The PCMC said that the officials reached late as they were attending a meeting with Leader of Opposition Ajit Pawar. "We walked out in protest against PCMC's non-serious approach to a serious issue," a representative said.

62.title: Congrats: Novak Djokovic to Rafael Nadal on the birth of his son
62.article_body: Congratulating 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal on the birth of his son, world number seven Novak Djokovic said, "It's a beautiful news. I wish his wife and baby a lot of health and happiness." He added, "As a father, I'm not gonna give any advice to him. He has a big family. I'm sure he will experience himself."

63.title: 3 arrested for cheating family of ₹46 lakh insurance in Thane
63.article_body: A relationship manager in an insurance company and her two accomplices have been arrested from Ulhasnagar for cheating a family of their policy worth ₹46.61 lakh. In March 2020, the employee approached the insured and under the pretext of updating the KYC took copies of all relevant documents. Later, the accomplices changed the policy to their name.

64.title: 28-year-old priest caught wearing burqa in Kerala, says he has 'chicken pox'
64.article_body: A 28-year-old temple priest wearing a burqa and moving around suspiciously was caught by public and handed over to police in Kerala's Kozhikode. Jishnu Namboothiri said he was wearing burqa as he had chicken pox. Police said they couldn't find any traces of chicken pox on preliminary examination and he was let off after they verified his name and address.

65.title: Ektaa Kapoor told me to be a producer for Hansal Mehta's next: Kareena
65.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan, who will feature in Hansal Mehta's next, has revealed that producer Ektaa Kapoor told her to make her debut as a producer for the untitled project. "I did it because I loved the script so much. I don't know if I'm going to start producing films because I don't know anything about it," Kareena added.

66.title: Several passengers injured as bus hits tempo after tyre burst in Pune
66.article_body: Several passengers were injured after a bus they were travelling in jumped a divider after suffering a tyre burst and hit a tempo in Pune district on Saturday. The accident occurred when the tempo was waiting in line to fill fuel at a gas station on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway near Sarola village. Police said injured passengers are out of danger.

67.title: Delhi to host first 'slum festival' on World Homeless Day on Mon
67.article_body: Delhi government will be organising its first 'slum festival' on World Homeless Day on October 10, a statement issued by Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board said. The festival aimed towards "sensitising the public about homelessness" will be held at the night shelter complex at Sarai Kale Khan. Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will be the chief guest at the event.

68.title: India-UK FTA talks face deadlock over data localisation: Report
68.article_body: India-UK free trade agreement (FTA) is facing a possible deadlock over issues like data localisation and UK firms being allowed to bid for Indian government contracts, according to reports. This comes after a UK government spokesperson said they "won't sacrifice quality over speed". "[We] will only sign when we have a deal that meets...UK's interests," the spokesperson had said.

69.title: Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam resigns over presence at conversion event
69.article_body: Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam has resigned from the Arvind Kejriwal cabinet on Sunday. This comes days after a video emerged of him at an event where 10,000 people converted to Buddhism. The BJP had criticised the event, where the crowd took BR Ambedkar's 22 vows and said they would not pray to Hindu gods and goddesses.

70.title: 3 arrested after attack that killed Israeli soldier in Jerusalem
70.article_body: Three Palestinians were arrested on Sunday for their suspected involvement in an attack on an Israeli military checkpoint on Saturday. An 18-year-old female soldier was killed and three others were injured after a Palestinian gunman opened fire at the checkpoint in east Jerusalem. A manhunt involving police and security officers, along with soldiers, was reportedly launched following the attack.

71.title: 5 electrocuted, 2 injured after Eid-e-Milad procession in UP's Bahraich
71.article_body: Five people, including four children, were killed and two others were injured after coming in contact with a high-tension wire after an Eid-e-Milad (Barawafat) procession in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district in the early hours of Sunday. The deceased children were aged between 10 and 17 years. CM Yogi Adityanath expressed his condolences to the families of the deceased.

72.title: 48-year-old actress Hilary Swank pregnant with twins, shares her pics
72.article_body: American actress Hilary Swank, who won the Best Actress Oscar for her film 'Boys Don't Cry', has revealed that she is pregnant with twins. "Coming soon…DOUBLE feature," the 48-year-old actress wrote on Instagram as she shared pictures of her baby bump. "This is something that I've been wanting for a long time," the actress said.

73.title: Javagal Srinath forgets handing coin to captain at toss ahead of India-SA ODI, video viral
73.article_body: A video went viral showing referee Javagal Srinath forgetting to hand coin to India captain Shikhar Dhawan at toss ahead of the second India-South Africa ODI. After introducing the captains and referee, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar asked who has got the coin. Dhawan and Keshav Maharaj looked at each other in confusion before realising Srinath's yet to hand Dhawan the coin.

74.title: Tokyo Olympian swimmer Srihari wins 6th gold at 36th National Games
74.article_body: Tokyo Olympian swimmer Srihari Nataraj won his sixth gold medal at 36th National Games after clinching the men's 100m freestyle gold on Saturday. Srihari, representing Karnataka, clocked 50.41s to set a new National Games record. This was Srihari's second gold in freestyle swimming events at the Games. He had earlier won two gold medals each in backstroke and relay events.

75.title: Centre, Delhi govt failed to safeguard lives during Delhi riots: Report
75.article_body: According to a report, the Centre and Delhi government "failed to fulfil their solemn obligation to safeguard lives, property and the rule of law" during the 2020 Delhi violence. It criticised the Ministry of Home Affairs, along with stating that the media played a "key role in propagating hateful narratives". The report was authored by a committee of former judges.

76.title: Ranbir Kapoor says he won't come on 'Koffee With Karan' ever: Johar
76.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that Ranbir Kapoor teases him and says that he will not come on 'Koffee With Karan' ever. "I'll try and convince him for the next season," Johar added. The filmmaker stated, "I'm hoping...we can do something solid with Shah Rukh Khan in the next season because he's been such a huge part of the show."

77.title: Saif said 'You're a fresh air, performed very well': Yogita on 'Vikram...'
77.article_body: Actress Yogita Bihani, opening up about the best compliment she received for playing Chanda in 'Vikram Vedha', said, "Saif (Ali Khan) told me, 'You are a fresh air, it's a good casting and you have performed very well.'" "He also said, 'You brighten up the screen!'" she added. "That was the best compliment coming from him," Yogita said.

78.title: BJP's 'antim yatra' will begin when Cong's Bharat Jodo ends: Cong
78.article_body: When Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' concludes in Kashmir, BJP's "antim yatra" will begin, said Goa Congress President Amit Patkar on Saturday. He said that BJP's foundation was based on the "Fake in India" mission under "Jumla Raj" of PM Narendra Modi, whose MA in political science is a "mystery". Lakhs of people are joining Rahul Gandhi every day, he added.

79.title: Ratan Tata awarded 'Sewa Ratna' by RSS-affiliate Sewa Bharati
79.article_body: RSS-affiliated Sewa Bharati has awarded 'Sewa Ratna' to Ratan Tata for his philanthropic efforts. For their "priceless contribution in social work or providing funds for social development", 24 other dignitaries and social institutions were also awarded, Sewa Bharati said. Recently, Ratan Tata announced an investment in Goodfellows, a startup that offers companionship to senior citizens.

80.title: She'll do something incredible: Margot on Lady Gaga as Harley Quinn
80.article_body: Margot Robbie has reacted to Lady Gaga being cast as Harley Quinn in 'Joker: Folie à Deux', saying that "she'll do something incredible with it". Margot portrayed Harley Quinn in several films, including 'Suicide Squad' and 'Birds of Prey'. 'Joker: Folie à Deux', the second part of Todd Phillips' 'Joker', is expected to release on October 4, 2024.

81.title: 'Like 2 brothers': Kharge on contesting Cong Prez polls against Tharoor
81.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday likened his battle for the Congress President's post against Shashi Tharoor "like two brothers at home". He said the contest between the two leaders was aimed at putting forth their viewpoints for the betterment of the country and the party. The contest is about what the two leaders can do together, Kharge added.

82.title: Mumbai Police registers FIR over 'fake' affidavits supporting Uddhav-led Sena
82.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered an FIR against unidentified persons on charges of cheating and forgery, after recovering over 4,500 affidavits to support Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, an official said on Sunday. "It is my allegation that these false and fake affidavits of Shiv Sainiks had been prepared for filing before the EC," said Naresh Mhaske, spokesperson of Eknath Shinde-led Sena.

83.title: Armed criminals loot mobile shop of ₹1.5 cr in Delhi's Karol Bagh
83.article_body: A group of five-six armed criminals broke into a mobile accessories shop in Delhi's Karol Bagh and looted ₹1.5 crore at gunpoint, police said. Police said that the owner told them that a gang of criminals entered the shop posing as customers. The accused were wearing helmets to cover their faces and looted the store at gunpoint and escaped.

84.title: Tourist bus falls off hill in Andhra Pradesh, 10 passengers injured
84.article_body: At least 10 passengers were injured after a tourist bus fell off a hill in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitharamaraju district on Sunday. The accident took place at Vanajangi when the bus was going from Visakhapatnam to Paderu. The injured persons were rescued by the locals and later taken to a hospital.

85.title: 57 students mysteriously poisoned in Mexico school, one critical
85.article_body: At least 57 students were poisoned by an unidentified substance in a secondary school in the Mexican state of Chiapas, according to local authorities. One student in a "delicate" condition was transferred to a hospital in the state's capital. The authorities conducted 15 toxicology exams and all of them came out negative for illicit drugs.

86.title: K'taka CM inaugurates 'Naga Mantapa' at Isha Yoga Centre in B'luru
86.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai inaugurated the 'Naga Mantapa' at the Isha Yoga Centre in Bengaluru on Saturday. The 'Naga Mantapa' will be open to the public from October 10 (Monday). "Sadhguru is a global Guru from Karnataka," Bommai said. Over 5,000 residents from Chikkaballapura participated in the event.

87.title: 7 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹1 lakh cr to m-cap; RIL top gainer
87.article_body: Market capitalisation (m-cap) of seven of top 10 most valued firms rose to ₹1.01 lakh crore last week. Top gainer Reliance Industries Limited's m-cap rose by ₹37,581.61 crore to ₹16.46 lakh crore. It was followed by Tata Consultancy Services, whose m-cap rose by ₹22,082.37 crore to ₹11.21 lakh crore. Hindustan Unilever's m-cap dropped by ₹23,025.99 crore to ₹6.10 lakh crore.

88.title: Most artistes in music industry are valued after their death: Kavita Seth
88.article_body: Singer Kavita Seth expressed her disappointment that "most artistes in the music industry are valued only after they have left the world". Remembering KK, Kavita said after his demise, people remembered his work, but when he was alive, "the same people didn't care to give him the respect that he deserved". The singer said people should start valuing good artistes.

89.title: No one in the world can cope with the Haaland situation at the moment: Klopp
89.article_body: Praising Manchester City forward Erling Haaland, Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp said, "Nobody in the world can cope with the Erling Haaland situation at the moment, it's crazy what he's doing." He added, "He's an exceptional player in an exceptional team." The 22-year-old, who joined Manchester City from Borussia Dortmund this season, has scored 15 goals in nine Premier League matches.

90.title: Didn't anyone from Jammu deserve to be J&K LG?: Mufti
90.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday said that the BJP could have made a Lieutenant Governor (LG) from Jammu but instead, they made the LG of J&K from Uttar Pradesh. Furthermore, she said, "Didn't anyone from Jammu deserve to be the LG?" "They…[told] people of Jammu that they’ll make a CM from Jammu," Mufti said.

91.title: People should learn compassion, dedication from Valmiki: Mohan Bhagwat
91.article_body: On the occasion of Valmiki Jayanti, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that people should learn compassion, dedication and a sense of duty from Maharishi Valmiki. "I attended the inauguration of the first Valmiki temple in Nagpur. If Valmiki had not written the Ramayana, we would not have known about Lord Ram," said Bhagwat during his address to Valmiki Samaj.

92.title: Assam CM shares video of rhino hit by truck, says 'won’t allow infringement on their space'
92.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday shared a video wherein a rhinoceros got hit by a truck at Haldibari in Dhubri district. Sharing the video, he wrote, "Rhinos are our special friends; we'll not allow any infringement on their space... In this unfortunate incident...the rhino survived...To save animals at Kaziranga, we're working on a special 32-km elevated corridor."

93.title: Having Haaland helps Kevin De Bruyne a lot: City's Pep Guardiola
93.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said having Erling Haaland in the team helps midfielder Kevin De Bruyne a lot in the games. "For Kevin...to have this threat, pace and movement in behind helps a lot," said Guardiola after 4-0 win over Southampton. Kevin has registered nine assists in as many EPL matches so far this season.

94.title: 52-yr-old man loses ₹1.50 lakh in debit card swap fraud in Chandigarh
94.article_body: Two unidentified men allegedly withdrew ₹1.50 lakh from a man’s bank account after swapping his debit card at an ATM in Chandigarh, police said. They offered help to 52-year-old victim as he was unable to withdraw cash. However, they also couldn't withdraw cash at that time. Later, victim realised his card was swapped and cash was withdrawn from his account.

95.title: PM Narendra Modi wishes everyone on Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi
95.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone on Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi, which is the birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad and is observed in the month of Rabi-ul-Awwal. "May this occasion further the spirit of peace, togetherness and compassion in our society. Eid Mubarak," PM Modi wrote on Twitter. Muslims celebrate the occasion by wearing new clothes, offering prayers and exchanging gifts.

96.title: 9-year-old thalassemia patient becomes doctor for a day in B'luru
96.article_body: Bengaluru's Narayana Health City said it helped Fathima AK, a nine-year-old thalassemia patient, realise her dream by letting her be a doctor for a day. She assisted doctors in the OPD and also went along with them to meet inpatients. "It was the best day of my life. It's exhilarating to know how their work impacts our life," Fathima said.

97.title: Over 200 whales die in mass stranding at NZ's Chatham Islands
97.article_body: Over 200 pilot whales have died after getting stranded on the shores of New Zealand's Chatham Islands, the country's Department of Conservation said on Saturday. The department added that some of the whales that survived were euthanised. The whales couldn't be refloated due to "the risks of a shark attack" on humans and the whales, according to conservation officers.

98.title: Airbus, Air France face trial over crash that claimed 228 lives
98.article_body: Aircraft manufacturer Airbus and French flag carrier Air France will go on trial on Monday over the crash of Flight 447 on June 1, 2009. The flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris plunged into the Atlantic Ocean during a storm, killing 228 people on board. Airbus and Air France have been charged with involuntary manslaughter in the case.

99.title: New scam targets people with 'your electricity will be disconnected' texts
99.article_body: Scammers are targeting people by sending them texts on WhatsApp and via SMS claiming that their electricity connection will be disconnected unless they contact a certain number. "Your Electricity Power will disconnect at 9:30 pm as your last month's bill wasn't updated. Call us [mobile number]," a text read. The scammers could potentially defraud the recipients of their money.

100.title: Not even 1% of Adipurush is a deviation from Ramayan: Dialogue writer Manoj
100.article_body: 'Adipurush' dialogue writer Manoj Muntashir addressed the criticism that his film has been receiving and said that "not even 1% of [the] film is a deviation from actual Ramayan". "This is the story we've lived with, are retelling and showing," he added. Meanwhile, director Om Raut said, "This isn't a film for us...This is a representation of our devotion, faith."

101.title: I don't understand American terms like depression, I am a farmer: Kapil Dev
101.article_body: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev, in a recent event, said he doesn't understand "American terms" like depression and pressure. "I'm a farmer and we play because we enjoy the game...There can't be any pressure while enjoying the game," he said. "If cricketers are passionate, they shouldn't feel pressure. If they feel pressure, they shouldn't play," he added.

102.title: Had to do this: Prithviraj on producing Malayalam version of 'Kantara'
102.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran, who called 'Kantara' a "glorious cinematic achievement", announced that he'd be producing the Malayalam version of the Rishab Shetty film. "I absolutely HAD to do this after watching the Kannada version," he said. Trade analyst Taran Adarsh also shared that the Hindi and Telugu versions of the Kannada film will release on October 14 and 15, respectively.

103.title: Pune Zilla Parishad to build memorial for staffers who died fighting COVID
103.article_body: The Pune Zilla Parishad is planning to build a memorial for 35 staffers who died during the pandemic while undertaking efforts to curb COVID-19. According to its Chief Executive Officer Ayush Prasad, these staffers were working either in hospitals or in "extension health services". "A committee has been formed to formalise the design," he added.

104.title: 6 people booked for abducting, assaulting man in Gurugram's Sohna
104.article_body: Six people were booked for allegedly abducting and assaulting a man in Silani village in Sohna, Gurugram. The incident happened after the victim, Ashok Kumar, opened fire using his revolver during an argument between him and his accused relatives, police said. The suspects will be soon arrested while Ashok was arrested and booked under the Arms Act, police added.

105.title: Gross direct tax collection jumps 24% YoY to ₹9 lakh cr in H1 FY23
105.article_body: Gross direct tax collection on corporate and individual earnings rose 23.8% YoY to ₹8.98 lakh crore between April 1 and October 8, 2022, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said. While gross collection of taxes on corporate earning rose 16.73% YoY, personal income tax collection jumped 32.30% YoY. In the same time period, refunds worth ₹1.52 lakh crore were issued.

106.title: I hope Ishan Kishan takes on more responsibility: Aakash Chopra
106.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said he wants India batter Ishan Kishan to take on more responsibility in the ongoing ODI series against South Africa. "You're getting the chances now, but once the T20 World Cup is done, the seniors will be available and they will play," explained Aakash. Ishan was dismissed after scoring 20(37) in the first SA ODI.

107.title: I've no idea what is fair: Medvedev on retiring vs Djokovic at Astana Open
107.article_body: Explaining the reason behind his retirement midway against Novak Djokovic in Astana Open semi-final, Daniil Medvedev said, "It's the second time in my life I retired like this with a pulled muscle." He added that playing another set would've resulted in missing half a year instead of a month and he doesn't have any idea about what is fair.

108.title: Rahul will be seen in new avatar after Bharat Jodo Yatra: Digvijaya
108.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Sunday said that Rahul Gandhi will be seen in a new avatar after the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra. Singh said that Gandhi has become a symbol of "Bharat Jodo", adding that people are very impressed that he's walking all the way during the yatra. Notably, Gandhi is spearheading the yatra that will end in J&K.

109.title: Be happy that people care: Ramiz Raja recalls advice to Babar over his criticism
109.article_body: Recalling a conversation with Pakistan captain Babar Azam about facing constant criticism, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said he has told Babar to take the feedback positively. "I say to Babar, 'Be happy that cricket isn't like any other sport in Pakistan where people don't care about them'," revealed Raja. "When people are engaged, they will form opinions," he added.

110.title: Swastika shares pic with WB CM, says 'Wished her Shubho Bijoya & got chocolates'
110.article_body: Actress Swastika Mukherjee met West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee at the Durga Puja Carnival on Red Road in Kolkata. The actress took to Twitter to share a picture where she was seen interacting with Banerjee. Swastika wrote, "Have always admired her indomitable spirit and fiery personality. Wished her Shubho Bijoya and got chocolates."

111.title: Pune hospital performs rare procedure on newborn with heart disease
111.article_body: A newborn with complex congenital heart disease underwent a rare hybrid procedure known as patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) stenting at Pune's Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences. The baby had pulmonary atresia in which the pulmonary valve is absent. The team that performed the procedure included cardiologists, a cardio-thoracic surgeon and a cardiac anaesthetist.

112.title: Newborn girl found in garbage dump in Delhi's Vasant Kunj is stable: Police
112.article_body: Delhi Police on Sunday said that the newborn girl who was found in a garbage dump and admitted to a private hospital in Vasant Kunj is in stable condition. "The baby was drenched due to rain, extremely weak and in a hypothermic state with the umbilical cord attached," said Dr Rahul Nagpal, Director and HOD, Pediatrics, Fortis Hospital, Vasant Kunj.

113.title: Workers fall from scaffolding at Delhi airport; 2 dead, 6 injured
113.article_body: Two labourers died and six others were injured after they fell from the scaffolding at a construction site in Terminal 1 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport. While one worker was declared brought dead, the other died during treatment, DCP (IGI Airport) Tanu Sharma said. Sharma added that a case has been filed against the contractor in the matter.

114.title: Uddhav submits 'Rising Sun & Trishul' as alternatives after EC freezes Sena symbol
114.article_body: A day after the EC froze the name and symbol of Shiv Sena, Uddhav Thackeray submitted a list of three names and symbols, reports said. The Uddhav-led faction chose 'Shiv Sena Balasaheb Thackeray', 'Shiv Sena Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray' and 'Shiv Sena Prabodhankar Thackeray' as party names while choosing 'Trishul', a 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbols.

115.title: Miss your noise, it's too quiet: Neetu on late husband Rishi Kapoor
115.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of her late husband, actor Rishi Kapoor. Along with the picture, Neetu wrote, "Miss your noise, it's too quiet." Several celebrities, including Anushka Sharma and Maniesh Paul, reacted to the post. The veteran actor passed away on April 30, 2020, at 67.

116.title: Tipu was barbarian: Malviya on Owaisi's remark over renaming of Tipu Express
116.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya reacted to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi’s remark over renaming of Tipu Express. "BJP will never be able to erase Tipu's legacy," Owaisi had said. Following his reaction, Malviya tweeted, "BJP doesn't want to erase the legacy of Tipu. On the contrary, we want his true legacy to be known to the people. Tipu was a barbarian."

117.title: Rahul Gandhi should think before speaking against Savarkar: Shiv Sena
117.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande condemned Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's remark against VD Savarkar and asked him to think before making such statements. "We prohibit Rahul Gandhi's statement and the Shiv Sena's opinion towards Savarkar is the same and it will never change," said Manisha. Earlier, Rahul had claimed that Savarkar used to work for the Britishers.

118.title: Hurricane Julia makes landfall in Nicaragua; 6,000 evacuated
118.article_body: Hurricane Julia made landfall in Nicaragua early Sunday, hours after lashing Colombia's San Andres island in a close pass-by. Nearly 6,000 people were moved to safer locations by Nicaraguan authorities ahead of Julia's arrival. Julia started off as a tropical storm on Saturday but developed into a Category 1 hurricane shortly before passing through the close vicinity of San Andres.

119.title: MK Stalin elected unopposed as DMK President for second time
119.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was unanimously elected as DMK President at the party's general council meeting held in Chennai on Sunday. Party leaders Durai Murugan and TR Baalu were unanimously elected as General Secretary and Treasurer, respectively, with all three leaders being elected to their posts for the second time.

120.title: Google shutting down its Assistant Driving Mode on Nov 21: Report
120.article_body: Google is shutting down its Maps integration in Assistant Driving Mode Dashboard on November 21, according to a 9to5Google report. The Dashboard features media suggestions and quick access to audio controls, along with shortcuts for calling and texting. The car-optimised experience in Google Maps for Android, which Google also refers to as Driving Mode, will remain, the report said.

121.title: Boy rapes 4-yr-old neighbour after offering her candies in Gurugram
121.article_body: A 15-year-old boy allegedly raped his four-year-old neighbour after offering her candies in Gurugram on Tuesday evening. The victim was alone at her home when the boy allegedly raped her and urinated on her. The girl is being treated at a hospital for a stomach infection, while the boy has been apprehended and sent to a correctional home in Faridabad.

122.title: Delhi sees 2nd highest rainfall since 2007, temp margin drops to record low: IMD
122.article_body: The national capital received the second highest rainfall since 2007 in the last 24 hours till 8.30 am, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Sunday. Due to continuous rainfall, the difference between minimum temperature (20.8 degrees Celsius) on Friday and maximum temperature (23.4 degrees Celsius) on Saturday was 2.6 degrees Celsius - the lowest since 1969, IMD officials said.

123.title: Eng destroyed us in T20 WC 2021, it was a turning point for Aus: Wade
123.article_body: Discussing Australia's defeat against England in T20 World Cup 2021 where England chased down a target of 126 in 11.4 overs, wicketkeeper Matthew Wade said, "They destroyed us." "It was...a turning point for the way we...[play] T20s," added Wade. "We've got seven batters...We've got...power and...depth [in] batting that...you need to go with [while facing] a team like England," he stated.

124.title: Assange's supporters form human chain in UK over extradition
124.article_body: Supporters of WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange formed a human chain outside the UK Parliament after the government approved his extradition to the US to face criminal charges. Assange's wife Stella said that the extradition is a "stain" on the UK and US President Joe Biden-led administration. Pictures and a video of the human chain have surfaced online.

125.title: Never seen a liar like Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal: BJP's CR Paatil
125.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for his "Kansa" remark and called him a liar. He also asked him to think before making such statements. "We have never seen a liar like Arvind Kejriwal. Despite being a CM, he peddles lies. He called people of Gujarat 'Kansa' & then he's seeking votes from them," said Paatil.

126.title: Ex-senator briefly held hostage during breakout bid in Philippines
126.article_body: An undertrial Philippine politician, Leila de Lima, was briefly held hostage during an attempted prison break in the Manila capital region, police said on Sunday. De Lima, a former senator, emerged unhurt from the incident, as per authorities. The three prisoners who staged the failed breakout were shot dead by police. One police officer was stabbed by the inmates.

127.title: Neetu Kapoor shares Ranbir's pics from 'Brahmastra' look test showing his 6-pack abs
127.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to share pictures of her son Ranbir Kapoor from 'Brahmastra' look test showing his six-pack abs. The pictures were originally shared by Ranbir's trainer and lifestyle coach Kunal Gir. "This one is for all Ranbir Kapoor fans. These are unseen pics taken during a look test in Bulgaria," he wrote in the caption.

128.title: Domino's responds after man shared pics of glass shards in pizza, says 'No anomaly found'
128.article_body: After a man in Mumbai shared pictures of glass shards that he allegedly found in his Domino's pizza, the company said that they will collect samples from the customer. Domino's said, "We immediately contacted the customer...Our quality team has also conducted a thorough investigation...and no anomaly was found...We follow a strict no-glass policy in our kitchen and operation area."

129.title: RSS chief's call to end caste system must be implemented: Pawar
129.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar threw his weight behind RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's call to end the age-old caste system that leads to discrimination within society. "The concept of untouchability was never part of religious text or practice," Bhagwat said, adding that the concepts of 'varna' and 'jati' had no place for discrimination, even in the past.

130.title: B'luru techie makes hoax bomb threats to Vidhana Soudha; arrested
130.article_body: A 41-year-old unemployed software engineer was arrested on Friday for making three hoax bomb calls to Karnataka Chief Secretary's office in Bengaluru's Vidhana Soudha. Police used sniffer dogs to search the Chief Secretary's office after Prashanth Kumar called at 2:06 pm on Friday and claimed he'd planted bombs. Kumar was arrested hours later from his home in Bengaluru's Hebbagodi.

131.title: England record highest-ever T20I total by a visiting team in Australia
131.article_body: England on Sunday recorded the highest-ever T20I total by a visiting team in Australia. England registered 208/6 in the first T20I in Perth to set the record. The previous record was jointly held by India and England, who had recorded 200/3 and 200/9 in Sydney and Hobart in 2016 and 2014, respectively. Alex Hales top-scored for England today with 84(51).

132.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part Two' to release in Summer 2023: Report
132.article_body: Trade analyst Taran Adarsh shared that the makers of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part Two' are "targeting a Summer 2023 release". He further informed that unlike 'Baahubali 2' and 'KGF 2', the sequel of the Mani Ratnam directorial was shot simultaneously with the first part. Recently, the makers announced that 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' crossed ₹300 crore worldwide at the box office.

133.title: 'Defectors platter' belongs to Shinde faction for serving BJP: Sibal
133.article_body: While reacting to the EC's decision to freeze the 'bow and arrow' symbol of the Shiv Sena, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the 'defectors platter' belongs to Eknath Shinde's faction for serving the BJP. EC freezing the Shiv Sena symbol amounts to "freezing democracy", he said, adding that the symbol belongs to the faction led by Uddhav Thackeray.

134.title: 4.4kg gold hidden in clothes, bags & hairband seized at Hyd airport
134.article_body: Customs officials have seized about 4.4 kg gold in separate incidents at Hyderabad airport. In first incident, three passengers tried to smuggle gold by concealing it in undergarments and chains. Two passengers who hid gold in their check-in baggage were intercepted in the second incident, while in the last incident, a passenger concealed gold in a hairband and dress parts.

135.title: Zomato CEO delivers orders once in 3 months, nobody recognised him: Investor
135.article_body: Zomato's Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal wears a red t-shirt and spends a day delivering orders himself at least once a quarter on a motorcycle, Naukri.com owner and Zomato's early investor Sanjeev Bikhchandani has revealed. "Deepinder tells me that thus far nobody has recognised him," Bikhchandani added. Not only Goyal but all senior managers at Zomato do the same.

136.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav quite critical, on life-saving drugs: Medanta Hospital
136.article_body: Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital on Sunday said former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav’s condition is quite critical today and he is on life-saving drugs. "He is being treated in the ICU of the hospital by a comprehensive team of specialists," Dr Sanjeev Gupta, Medical Director, Medanta Hospital, Gurugram, said. He has been undergoing treatment at the hospital since August 22.

137.title: Muslims using condoms most: Owaisi on RSS chief's 'population' remark
137.article_body: Following RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's 'population imbalance' remark, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "Don't take tension. Muslim population is not rising. In fact, it's on the decline." "Do you know who is...using condoms the most? [Muslims] are doing," Owaisi added. Notably, Bhagwat had called for a population control policy, saying that religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored.

138.title: Part of road collapses near under-construction building in Greater Noida
138.article_body: A portion of a road near an under-construction building in Greater Noida caved in on Sunday after incessant rain lashed parts of NCR for past two days. No injuries have been reported after the collapse. A video of the collapse showed a cave-in a few metres long. Three bulldozers and five dumpers have been deployed to fill the caved-in section.

139.title: Man snatches phone from woman travelling on scooty in Gurugram
139.article_body: A man allegedly snatched a woman's mobile phone while she was riding pillion on a scooty in  Gurugram. The suspect approached the woman, Bhawna Sharma, and fled after snatching her iPhone from her hands when the latter was returning home in Sushant Lok Phase-I from Ambience Mall, police said. Notably, an FIR was registered at DLF Phase-III Police Station.

140.title: What about Amitabh, Madhuri?: BJP on Pawar's Muslim-Bollywood remark
140.article_body: Responding to NCP chief Sharad Pawar's remark that Muslim minorities have made the biggest contribution to Bollywood, BJP asked whether Pawar can deny contributions made by Amitabh Bachchan and Madhuri Dixit. "So terrorists have no religion, but art and cinema have a religion, Pawar saheb?" the BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla asked.

141.title: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone's 'Pathaan' to get a sequel: Reports
141.article_body: The makers of 'Pathaan' are reportedly working on a sequel to the film. "The team of Pathaan has begun writing...sequel to the film," a source was quoted as saying. The upcoming action film, starring Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham, is set to release in theatres on January 25, 2023. It is directed by Siddharth Anand.

142.title: Mumbai Police releases traffic advisory for Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions
142.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police have made arrangements to ensure smooth commute amid Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions, which will be taken out in parts of the city today. As per the advisory, traffic restrictions are imposed on certain areas like Byculla, Pydhonie, Dongri, Azad Maidan, among others. The restrictions on travel would be effective from 2 pm to the time the processions conclude.

143.title: Thanks for being the wind beneath my wings: Pujara to wife on her b'day
143.article_body: Team India batter Cheteshwar Pujara took to Twitter to wish his wife Puja on her birthday, terming her as the "wind beneath" his wings. "You don't just make me happy, you make me proud. My affection towards you grows with each passing year," added Pujara in his tweet. "Thank you for being you!" stated Pujara in his tweet.

144.title: Karnataka to witness heavy rainfall till October 11: IMD
144.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted rainfall across Karnataka till October 11. The forecast says that heavy and thunderous rainfall is expected in coastal Karnataka, north interior and south interior districts of the state. A yellow alert has also been issued for several north Karnataka districts, including Belagavi and Raichur.

145.title: Man arrested in B'luru for drug peddling, over 300 bottles of cough syrup seized
145.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a man for allegedly peddling the Alluring Narcotic drug ESKUF (cough syrup) and seized 356 bottles of the cough syrup and a two-wheeler from the accused. The ESKUF cough syrup can only be sold with a proper medical prescription. The drug is reportedly known to be misused by mixing it with banned narcotic substances.

146.title: PM Narendra Modi wishes people on Valmiki Jayanti
146.article_body: PM Modi extended greetings on Valmiki Jayanti and also shared a video. The day marks the birth anniversary of Maharishi Valmiki who is credited with writing the original Ramayana. The UP government has decided to celebrate his anniversary in a grand manner across the state, including the continuous recital of the Ramayana at all temples of Lord Ram and Hanuman.

147.title: PM Modi responds to man's 'must visit Kashmir' tweet, shares pic of his visit to Srinagar
147.article_body: PM Narendra Modi recently responded to a tweet of a man who shared pictures from his recent trip to Kashmir and urged that people 'must visit'. Sharing a picture from his visit to the valley, PM Modi wrote, "Excellent. I'm also tempted to share a picture from my visit to Srinagar in 2019."

148.title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Kamakhya temple in Guwahati
148.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at the Kamakhya temple in Assam's Guwahati on Sunday during his three-day visit to the Northeast. He was accompanied by Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. "Feeling extremely blessed after praying at the Maa Kamakhya Devi Temple in Guwahati," Shah tweeted. CM Sarma tweeted a video of Union Home Minister’s visit to the temple.

149.title: Businesses can remain open 24×7 in Delhi, over 300 applications cleared: Report
149.article_body: Businesses like restaurants, transport services, BPOs and online delivery services which apply for exemptions will be allowed to operate 24×7 in Delhi starting next week, an official told The Indian Express. Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena recently approved the proposal to exempt 314 such places to operate all day long, some of them pending since 2016, the official added.

150.title: I don't think about it: Rizwan on contest with Surya for no.1 T20I batter's spot
150.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan, on being asked about competition with India batter Suryakumar Yadav for the top spot in the ICC T20I batters' rankings, said, "I don't think much about it." He added, "Suryakumar is a good player and the way he plays I really enjoy it." Rizwan is currently the top-ranked batter in T20Is, while Suryakumar is placed second.

151.title: WhatsApp's clone app may be spying on Indian users: Report
151.article_body: 'GB WhatsApp', a clone of the Meta-owned messaging app WhatsApp, may be spying on Indian users and reading their chats, according to a report by ESET, the maker of NOD32 antivirus. The cloned third-party version of WhatsApp isn't available on Google Play. Hence, the versions of the clone app available on various download websites are riddled with malware, ESET added.

152.title: Boat capsizes in Nigeria amid heavy flooding; 10 dead, 60 missing
152.article_body: At least 10 people have died and 60 others are missing after a boat capsized in Nigeria's Anambra state amid heavy flooding, officials said on Saturday. The country's National Emergency Management Agency zonal coordinator said that around 85 people were on board the boat. At least 15 people have been rescued, Anambra's emergency management agency head said.

153.title: UK's trade minister fired after being seen touching a young man's thigh in a bar
153.article_body: UK's trade minister Conor Burns was removed from his position after he was allegedly seen touching a young man's thigh in a bar at the Tory Party conference. While he was asked to leave the government "with immediate effect", Burns has denied any wrongdoing. Notably, Burns was a long-time ally of former Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

154.title: Raavan looks like Khilji in 'Adipurush', are you making fun?: Mukesh
154.article_body: 'Shaktimaan' actor Mukesh Khanna said Saif Ali Khan's Raavan in 'Adipurush' looks like a Khilji ruler. He added, "[Saif] has been given a Mughal look. Are you making fun?" Mukesh further "warned" the "intellectual and rich people" to not use their money to change "rituals, religion and epic". Saif's look was trolled on Twitter after the 'Adipurush' teaser was released.

155.title: Govt starts probe as US fines Oracle over ₹3.3 cr bribe to railway officials: Report
155.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has reportedly initiated a probe against Oracle after the US SEC fined the company for paying about $400,000 (₹3.3 crore) in bribes to railway officials in 2019. "Oracle India sales employees...used an excessive discount scheme in connection with a transaction with a transportation company, a majority of which was owned by the Indian...Railways," the SEC said.

156.title: My best wishes for this endeavour: PM Modi on Puneeth's 'Gandhada Gudi'
156.article_body: PM Narendra Modi sent his best wishes for late actor Puneeth Rajkumar's upcoming film 'GG - Gandhada Gudi', which he called "a tribute to Mother Nature". Puneeth's wife Ashwini tweeted that the actor "cherished" his interactions with Modi. In response, Modi wrote that Puneeth "lives in the hearts of millions around the world" and was "blessed with unparalleled talent".

157.title: Tharoor’s appeal goes beyond party, Cong needs urgent reformist thinking: Karti
157.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram backed the party’s Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor, saying the latter’s pragmatic modernism coupled with his appeal beyond the party, is crucial to fight BJP’s divisive politics. "Status quo and business as usual won’t help our party. There’s an urgent need for reformist thinking in our party," Karti Chidambaram added.

158.title: Sonali's family receives 2 letters alleging ₹10-cr deal in murder case, naming politicians
158.article_body: Sonali Phogat's family members have said that they received two letters from an anonymous sender, with her brother-in-law Aman Poonia stating that both the letters should be investigated. The first letter, which was received a month ago, has alleged that a deal of ₹10 crore was made in the murder case. Meanwhile, the other letter mentioned names of political leaders.

159.title: Max Verstappen wins F1 world championship for 2nd year in a row
159.article_body: Red Bull's 25-year-old Dutch driver Max Verstappen on Sunday won the Japanese Grand Prix to clinch Formula One 2022 world championship with four races left in the season. Verstappen has now won the world championship for the second year in a row. Verstappen is leading the 2022 driver standings with 366 points, followed by his teammate Sergio Perez (253 points).

160.title: NATO should do more to protect itself from Russia: German minister
160.article_body: German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said on Saturday that North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) should "do more" to protect itself from Russia, adding that no one knows "how far Putin's delusions of grandeur can go". Lambrecht made the remarks during a visit to Lithuania. She further said that Russia's threat of nuclear weapons shows that its authorities have "no scruples".

161.title: Delhi Police releases list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging
161.article_body: The national capital witnessed waterlogging in several areas due to continuous rainfall causing traffic congestion. The Delhi Traffic Police on Sunday issued an advisory asking commuters to "plan their journey accordingly". The police asked commuters to avoid Ashoka Road near New PHQ, Rohtak Road near Peeragarhi Chowk, Mathura Road near Lodhi Colony flyover foot and Lajpat Nagar metro station.

162.title: I'm upset with Haaland, jokes Guardiola after 4-0 win vs Southampton
162.article_body: After their 4-0 win over Southampton, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola jokingly said he was upset with striker Erling Haaland because he only scored once in the game. "The expectation is so high that everyone thinks that in every game he should score three or four goals," added Guardiola. Haaland has scored 15 goals in nine games in the EPL.

163.title: B'luru man who killed his grandmother over 'gobi manchurian' arrested
163.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested 27-year-old man who allegedly killed his grandmother over argument on a packet of gobi manchurian and buried her body inside the house with help of his mother. The police solved the murder case five years after the incident happened in 2016. The accused along with his mother vacated the house in 2017 and fled to Maharashtra.

164.title: Ranveer makes 7-foot-1-inch tall NBA legend O'Neal dance on 'Khalibali', video viral
164.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself making 7-foot-1-inch tall NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal dance on 'Khalibali'. "Big Man x Bad Man! The collab you didn’t know you needed! Here’s Shaq doing Khalibali! Yes. You read that right! Shaq-a-bibi!" Ranveer wrote. Actor Varun Dhawan commented, "The shaq attack."

165.title: Surprised, he looked fine: Djokovic on Medvedev retiring mid-match
165.article_body: Novak Djokovic said he was "surprised" to see Daniil Medvedev retire midway through their semi-final in the Astana Open 2022. "He looked completely fine...It is a shock," added Djokovic. "It was such a close match, particularly in the second set," he stated. "I am just sad for the tournament and for these people who were enjoying the battle," said Djokovic.

166.title: Meta's metaverse app facing quality issues, staff not using it enough: Exec in memo
166.article_body: Meta's flagship metaverse app, Horizon Worlds, is suffering from too many quality issues, according to an internal memo. In the memo, Meta's VP of Metaverse Vishal Shah, said the employees within the team aren't spending much time on Horizon. "Why don't we love the product we've built...If we don't love it, how can we expect...users to love it?" he added.

167.title: Legs of 100-year-old woman chopped off by robbers to steal her anklets in Jaipur
167.article_body: Police in Rajasthan's Jaipur have said that unidentified miscreants chopped off a 100-year-old woman's legs to steal her anklets. "She was lying severely injured near her house. Her neck had injuries too," police said. "My daughter called and told me about my mother lying injured...She was immediately rushed to the hospital," the victim's daughter said.

168.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against South Africa, make 2 changes
168.article_body: South Africa stand-in captain Keshav Maharaj won the toss and elected to bat first in the second ODI against India in Ranchi. India have made two changes to their playing XI with Shahbaz Ahmed and Washington Sundar replacing Ravi Bishnoi and Ruturaj Gaikwad. Notably, Shahbaz is making his ODI debut for India today.

169.title: 17 killed in rocket attack in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia: Official
169.article_body: At least 17 people were killed after buildings in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia were hit by rockets in an overnight attack by Russia, an official of the city council said on Sunday. The official added that about five private houses were destroyed and around 40 were damaged in the attack. The region's governor said, "There may be more people under the rubble."

170.title: 'Goodbye' tickets to be sold for ₹80 on Amitabh Bachchan's b'day: Report
170.article_body: To mark Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, the makers of 'Goodbye' have decided to sell the film's tickets for ₹80 on October 11. "The makers plan to promote this exciting offer and are confident that it'll result in huge footfalls," a source told Bollywood Hungama. The Vikas Bahl directorial, which released on October 7, features Amitabh with Rashmika Mandanna.

171.title: Shahbaz Ahmed should replace Gaikwad or Kishan in the 2nd ODI: Jaffer
171.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed should replace either Ruturaj Gaikwad or Ishan Kishan in Team India's lineup for the second ODI against South Africa. "Shahbaz...would be helpful in the bowling department and strengthen the batting...You cannot go ahead with...five bowling options in ODI cricket," added Jaffer. South Africa beat India by nine runs in the first ODI.

172.title: Twitter offered billions off the $44-billion deal to Elon, he refused: Musk's lawyer
172.article_body: Twitter offered "billions off the transaction price" to Elon Musk, an attorney for the world's richest person claimed. "Musk refused (the offer) because Twitter attempted to put certain self-serving conditions on the deal," Alex Spiro said. Musk has revived the $44-billion deal to take Twitter private at the original price of $54.20 per share, days before a trial in court.

173.title: Pralhad Joshi requests Gujarat CM to give space for Karnataka Bhavan
173.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi made an appeal to Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel to allow space for the construction of Karnataka Bhavan in the state. He told Gujarat CM that he would personally cooperate with the Karnataka government for the construction of the bhavan.
