Ukrainian troops have also destroyed 500 aircraft, including 234 helicopters, and 345 Multiple Launch Rocket Systems, the ministry added.

348.title: Neighbour kills girl to take revenge against her brother in Delhi
348.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly killed by her neighbour in north Delhi's Narela area, police said on Saturday. Upon interrogation, it was revealed that the accused committed the murder to take revenge against the victim's brother with whom he had a strained relationship. The girl's disappearance was reported to police around 10 pm on Friday. Her body has been recovered.

349.title: Delhi-Varanasi Vande Bharat Express train halted after suffering technical failure
349.article_body: The Delhi-Varanasi Vande Bharat Express train was halted in UP's Khurja after developing a failure, railway officials said. The train reportedly suffered a jammed wheel following which on-ground staff alerted the operations control to halt the train. The passengers of the Varanasi-bound train were shifted to Shatabdi Express at Khurja Junction.

350.title: Indian team hungry for podium finish at hockey WC 2023: Midfielder Hardik
350.article_body: Indian men's hockey team midfielder Hardik Singh said his side is capable of reaching the hockey World Cup 2023 final and winning it. "We didn't do well last time, but now after...Tokyo Olympics, things have changed overall for Indian hockey...The whole team is very hungry to get success this year and we want to finish on the podium," he added.

351.title: US will hurt, isolate itself: China on US rules limiting chip export
351.article_body: China termed US' new export policy limiting the sale of certain semiconductor chips to China as an abuse of trade measures and designed to maintain the country's "technological hegemony". "US will only hurt and isolate itself," China's Foreign Ministry said. The policy includes a measure to cut China off from certain chips made anywhere in the world with US equipment.

352.title: 72-year-old booked for shooting woman with airgun in Mumbai
352.article_body: A 72-year-old man was booked for allegedly injuring a female cyclist while trying to shoot a stray dog with an airgun in Vasai, Mumbai. The victim, Sarita Bhoir (28), who works as a housemaid, was going to her home when the accused, Michael Coutinho, shot at her thigh, police said. Coutinho allegedly ran inside his bungalow instead of helping Bhoir.

353.title: Chhattisgarh government to provide free WiFi services to 108 villages in Bastar
353.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has announced plans to provide free Wi-Fi connectivity to 108 villages in Bastar district under an agreement with BSNL. The connectivity will be available at Haat Bazaar, Panchayat Bhawan and other public places possessing a speed of 10 MBPS. Under the programme, 73 Bastar villages and 35 Tokapal development blocks will get the free services.

354.title: 2 persons on scooter die in road accident in UP's Saharanpur
354.article_body: Two persons, including a trader, died in a road accident in Nakur in UP's Saharanpur. The deceased, Ashok Kumar (35) and grocery merchant Anil Gupta (50), were travelling on a scooter when they were hit by an unknown vehicle, police said. Notably, Ashok died on the spot, while Anil succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, police said.

355.title: Haiti asks for international military assistance amid growing unrest
355.article_body: Haiti has asked for international military assistance to curb its gang violence crisis, which has paralysed the country, according to a document published on Friday. The document, signed by Prime Minister Ariel Henry and other top-ranking officials, states that they're alarmed by "the risk of a major humanitarian crisis" that is threatening the lives of many people in the country.

356.title: 9,000 people laid down arms in Assam under BJP Government: Amit Shah
356.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah hailed development work in the northeastern region and said that the BJP government has established peace in Assam with 9,000 people laying down arms. He claimed that Congress’ 70 years of rule had pushed the northeast into violence and anarchy. "During Congress' rule, there was a process of breaking India in the northeast," said Shah.

357.title: Tracxn Technologies raises nearly ₹139 crore from anchor investors
357.article_body: Tracxn Technologies has raised a little more than ₹139 crore from anchor investors. BNP Paribas Arbitrage, WhiteOak Capital Management, Kotak Mutual Fund, ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund, Nippon India Mutual Fund, and Reliance General Insurance are among the anchor investors. Tracxn was launched in 2015 by Neha Singh and Abhishek Goyal.

358.title: Do take part: PM as auction of his mementoes extended till Oct 12
358.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday urged people to take part in the e-auction of mementoes he has received over the years. He tweeted that the framed Replica of Kedarnath Temple, which is up for auction, is among the many special gifts he has received. "Respecting people's wishes, the auction of the mementoes has been extended till [October 12]," he added.

359.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant disconnected from power due to shelling: Ukraine
359.article_body: Russia-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine lost connection to external power supply due to shelling, Ukraine's state nuclear company Energoatom said, blaming Russia. The company said the available supplies of diesel for operation in this mode will be enough for 10 days. International Atomic Energy Agency recently said the danger of a catastrophic accident has not been averted.

360.title: Man in UK charged ₹32 lakh for a 15-minute Uber ride
360.article_body: A man was charged £35,427.92 (₹32.5 lakh) for a 15-minute Uber ride in UK. He stated he booked the cab to a pub when the price was displayed as £11-£12. On seeing the bill the next morning, he approached Uber, who informed him due to an error drop-off location was set to Australia and their engineers are looking into it.

361.title: I'm very close to Vijay Deverakonda, we share & discuss things: Rashmika
361.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, who is rumoured to be dating Vijay Deverakonda, said she is very close to the actor and often shares and discusses things with him. "I am very close to Vijay, which is why if I feel like asking about anything in the industry, I go and ask him. He is always there (for me)," Rashmika said.

362.title: Bail plea of man booked under UAPA in 2020 Delhi riots case rejected
362.article_body: A Delhi court rejected the bail plea of a man booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in connection with a 2020 northeast Delhi riots case. He attended "conspiratorial meetings" and was also one of the organisers of the Chand Bagh protest site, the court said. The accused has been in judicial custody since June 25, 2020.

363.title: Heard loud noise & came out, lucky to survive: Nashik bus fire survivor
363.article_body: A survivor in the Nashik bus fire incident that took place on Saturday that claimed the lives of 11 people, said that she heard a loud noise. "We were sleeping in the bus...The bus had caught fire. Somehow, I managed to get out of the bus along with my daughter...We are lucky to have survived," she added.

364.title: Bank credit growth jumps to 16.28% for fortnight ended September 23
364.article_body: Bank credit growth rose to 16.28% for the fortnight ended September 23, the Reserve Bank of India said. The overall non-food credit stood at ₹130.06 lakh crore as on September 23 as against ₹111.85 lakh crore in the year-ago period. The deposit growth was at 8.96% for the fortnight with overall deposits at ₹174.54 lakh crore.

365.title: Bandhan Bank posts advances, deposits growth in excess of 20% each
365.article_body: Kolkata-based Bandhan Bank posted an over 20% growth in advances and deposits each during the September quarter. Its gross advances increased 22% from last year to nearly ₹1 lakh crore. However, the figure doesn't include any potential write-offs. Deposits of the bank also neared the ₹1-lakh-crore mark, increasing 21% year-on-year during the said quarter.

366.title: Fire breaks out on 12th floor of building in Mumbai; residents seen trying to escape
366.article_body: A fire broke out on the 12th floor of a residential building in the New Tilak Nagar area in Mumbai's Chembur around 2.43 pm on Saturday, Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) said. No loss of life has been reported yet, it added. Pictures from the site have surfaced online wherein residents can be seen trying to escape.

367.title: Masood Bhai is force behind GodFather's success: Chiranjeevi thanks Salman
367.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi took to Instagram to congratulate his 'GodFather' co-star Salman Khan for the success of the film. He said that Salman's character, Vettavaliyan Masood Bhai, was the "force behind GodFather's stupendous success". "Thank you and I love you so much. Vande Mataram," he added. Salman made a cameo appearance in the film, which was directed by Mohan Raja.

368.title: GHMC to set up 90 km of cycling tracks across Hyderabad
368.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is planning to set up 90 km of cycling tracks in major areas of Hyderabad. The civic body aims to lay out both permanent and artificial tracks. Permanent cycling tracks will be laid from Habsiguda crossroads to Uppal crossroads, from Bairamalguda crossroads to Owaisi Junction and from Aramghar to Owaisi Junction, among other locations.

369.title: Ghaziabad family robbed of valuables worth ₹20 lakh at gunpoint
369.article_body: A family was at gunpoint robbed of cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh at their home in Ghaziabad's Nehru Nagar on Friday afternoon, police informed. According to the house owner, Raman Sareen, three robbers tried to enter his house claiming that they had come on his behalf. Sareen's wife and daughter were at home when the incident occurred, he said.

370.title: Won't do a project like this because of my upbringing: Prem Sagar on Adipurush
370.article_body: Ramanand Sagar's son Prem Sagar, reacting to ongoing controversy surrounding Om Raut's 'Adipurush', said, "How can you stop anyone from creating anything?" "He (Om Raut) hasn't called it Ramayan...He has the right to do it," Prem said, adding, "If I'd got...project like this...I wouldn't do it because of my upbringing." Ramanand directed 'Ramayan', which featured Arun Govil as Lord Ram.

371.title: Rivian to recall nearly all delivered EVs in US to fix defect
371.article_body: US-based electric vehicle maker Rivian will recall nearly all its vehicles delivered to customers after discovering that a fastener "may not have been sufficiently torqued", company's CEO RJ Scaringe said in a letter. The company is recalling about 13,000 vehicles after the issue was discovered in seven. The recall covers vehicles delivered since Rivian began production late last year.

372.title: Video shows the moment truck bomb exploded on key bridge linking Russia with Crimea
372.article_body: A CCTV footage showing the moment a truck bomb exploded on the key bridge linking Russia with Crimea has surfaced online. A large part of the bridge was engulfed in fire because of the explosion, which had also set ablaze seven oil tankers. The bridge was unveiled in 2018, after Crimea was annexed from Ukraine in 2014.

373.title: Telangana man sentenced to life term for setting wife on fire 6 yrs ago
373.article_body: A man in Telangana has been sentenced to life term for setting his wife on fire after pouring kerosene on her almost six years ago. Police said the wife had, before passing away, told them that the accused was addicted to alcohol and had abused her on December 24, 2016. He had set her on fire after doubting her fidelity.

374.title: Credit guarantee scheme for startups notified for loans up to ₹10 cr
374.article_body: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade has notified the establishment of the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups. The scheme will provide credit guarantees up to a specified limit against loans extended by financial institutions registered with SEBI. Exposure of individual cases would be capped at ₹10 crore, or the actual outstanding credit amount, whichever is less.

375.title: Musi river in Hyderabad most polluted in Telangana: NGT report
375.article_body: Musi river in Hyderabad has earned the distinction of being the most polluted river in Telangana in the latest National Green Tribunal (NGT) report. As per the report, high levels of coliform were discovered in the river, along with imbalanced levels of dissolved oxygen (DO) and biological oxygen demand (BOD). The report also tagged Nagole as the most polluted location.

376.title: 40-yr-old businessman shot, injured by unidentified man in Thane
376.article_body: A 40-year-old businessman, Sandeep Adsul, was shot and injured by an unidentified man in Thane, police said. The incident took place in Majiwada area on Friday evening, when Adsul, who operates a stone-crushing business, was standing outside his house, an official from Kapurbawdi police station said. A monetary transaction may be a motive for the attack, the official added.

377.title: Closure report filed in case against ex-Pune Police Commissioner
377.article_body: The police have filed a closure report against former Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla in the case regarding the alleged illegal phone tapping of a political leader, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said. The police filed a 'C summary' report, which is filed when the case was registered due to a "mistake" or the complaint is civil in nature.

378.title: Assam CM Himanta Sarma washes feet of senior BJP leaders, shares video
378.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma washed the feet of senior Bharatiya Janata Party leaders. He took to Twitter to share a video showing the same. "Honoured to have washed the feet of our respected senior BJP functionaries whose immense contributions helped strengthen our party's base in the early phase in Assam," he wrote.

379.title: National Games gold is reassuring my preparations are on right track: Atanu
379.article_body: Archer Atanu Das of West Bengal won men's individual recurve gold at 36th National Games, beating Services' Gurcharan Besra 6-4 in final on Thursday. "The upcoming year is very important for us. This gold is reassuring that my preparations are on...right track," he said. Atanu hasn't been able to make it to the Indian squad since his Tokyo Olympics performance.

380.title: 3 women arrested for killing woman, dumping her body in Mumbai
380.article_body: Three women were arrested for allegedly killing a woman and later dumping her body after stuffing it in a gunny bag in a nullah in Nehru Nagar, Mumbai. One of the suspects, Minal Pawar (25), was suspicious about the deceased being in an illicit relationship with her husband, therefore, she, along with her sister and friend, killed her, police said.

381.title: Bihar issues order to kill man-eating tiger in Valmiki Tiger Reserve
381.article_body: The forest authorities on Friday issued an order to kill a man-eating tiger in Bihar's Valmiki Tiger Reserve. "A team of shooters is on the job," said an official. The tiger has reportedly killed five people in the last few days, including a man in his 30s and a 12-year-old girl within a span of about 24 hours.

382.title: RSS was helping Britishers & Savarkar was getting stipend: Rahul
382.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday criticised the BJP and RSS, claiming that VD Savarkar was receiving a stipend from the British and that the RSS was helping the Britishers. "BJP was nowhere to be found in the freedom struggle. The BJP can't hide such facts. Congress and its leaders fought for freedom," said Rahul Gandhi.

383.title: Class 7 girl in Odisha tribal hostel dies day after delivering stillborn
383.article_body: A Class 7 girl studying in a tribal residential school in Odisha's Kandhamal died a day after she delivered a stillborn baby, officials said. The girl was found to be four months pregnant on September 23 following which she was kept in a childcare institution. A Class 10 student of another residential school was detained in connection with the case.

384.title: Epics like Ramayana cannot be made with technology: Mukesh Khanna
384.article_body: Reacting to the teaser of 'Adipurush' actor Mukesh Khanna said epics like Ramayana and Mahabharata cannot be made with technology. "Some people say, 'Who are you to object when the Censor Board has passed it?' Censor Board...hamara mai baap nahi hai (not our guardian)," he said. "Make 1,000 stories, but do not make fun of our deities," he added.

385.title: 7 people killed in explosion at gas station in Ireland
385.article_body: At least seven people were killed in an explosion at a gas station in northwest Ireland on Friday, police said on Saturday. "[It is] a shocking toll and there will be more, and it's a search operation now," Irish Prime Minister Micheal Martin said. He added that the entire country was numbed by the "utter devastation".

386.title: Development in J&K PM Modi's biggest achievement: Jitendra Singh
386.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh hailed PM Modi and called development in J&K his biggest achievement. He said that PM Modi ensured that all the concerns of the people were addressed sensitively. "It is the biggest achievement of PM Modi that in 70 years, each division of J&K has a common allocation for the proposed development projects," said Singh.

387.title: Russian & Turkish Presidents discuss bilateral ties & ending Ukraine war
387.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a phone conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin during which he reiterated Ankara's willingness to play its role in peacefully resolving the war in Ukraine, Erdogan's office said. The two leaders also discussed bilateral ties. Turkey is a NATO member which has rejected sanctions on Moscow but also criticised Russian invasion of Ukraine.

388.title: Man sent to morgue in Australia was alive, tried to get out of body bag: Reports
388.article_body: A 55-year-old man, who was declared dead and sent to a morgue at a hospital in Australia, was alive, reports said. Kevin Reid's body was placed in a resting position, however, doctor reportedly found that the body was lying differently than how the staff had described it. Reports further said that he tried to get out of the body bag.

389.title: Thought me wearing it was funny: Kanye after backlash over 'White Lives Matter' shirt
389.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has addressed the backlash and criticism he received for wearing a t-shirt with the controversial 'White Lives Matter' slogan that's often associated with white supremacy. Kanye said he "thought the shirt was a funny shirt" and that the idea of him wearing it was "funny". He said his father, an ex-Black Panther member, also found it funny.

390.title: CBI files charge-sheet against Anubrata Mondal in cattle smuggling case
390.article_body: CBI has filed a charge-sheet against Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal before a special court in West Bengal's Asansol in connection with the cattle smuggling case. "During the period 2014-18, Mondal had allegedly accumulated huge properties in and around Bolpur and Kolkata in his name and family members by using illegal cash received in cattle smuggling," CBI claimed.

391.title: Won't be a remote control of Sonia Gandhi: Mallikarjun Kharge
391.article_body: Senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge rejected claims that he would act as a remote control of current Congress chief Sonia Gandhi if he becomes the party's President. "People say I am a remote control...They say I will do what Sonia Gandhi will say. Let me tell you that there is no such thing as remote control in Congress," Kharge said.

392.title: 26 bodies recovered in U'khand avalanche mishap, search on for 3 trainees
392.article_body: A total of 26 bodies have been recovered so far from the site of the avalanche that took place in Uttarakhand on October 4. Reports said that a search and rescue operation is in progress for the remaining three mountaineers. An update by the Nehru Institute of Mountaineering confirmed the number of bodies found on October 4, 6 and 7.

393.title: Felt shy going to male gynaecologist as a teenager: Rakul
393.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh in an interview spoke about her upcoming movie 'Doctor G', which stars Ayushmann Khurrana as a male gynaecologist. She said she felt shy going to a male gynaecologist as a teenager. "When I grew older...I realised that's not how you look at it," she said, adding, "And that's the conversation even in the trailer."

394.title: Not against Adani, but against monopolisation of businesses: Rahul
394.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he is not "against the corporates but against the complete monopolisation of businesses as that weakens the country". Gandhi's statement came after he was asked about the recent announcement by the Adani Group of investing ₹65,000 crore in Congress-ruled Rajasthan. "Government has not used political power to help Adani in Rajasthan," Gandhi said.

395.title: Policemen make miscreants blow trumpets into each other's ears as punishment in MP
395.article_body: Policemen in MP's Jabalpur made several youths, who were caught blowing trumpets into passersby's ears, do the same to each other as punishment. A video of the incident showed the police telling the miscreants to blow the toy trumpets into each other's ears and making them do sit-ups. The video went viral with many Twitter users lauding the police's action.

396.title: Missile tests are self-defence actions against US threats: N Korea
396.article_body: North Korea on Saturday said its "missile tests are a normal, planned self-defence measure to protect the country's security and regional peace from direct US military threats". The tests don't harm the safety of neighbouring countries and regions, it added. North Korea has carried out six missile launches in 12 days, including launching an intermediate-range missile over Japan on Tuesday.

397.title: Owner suspects neighbour 'poisoned' dog after dog dies in Gurugram
397.article_body: A case was filed after a man alleged that his neighbour poisoned his pet dog after it died under mysterious circumstances in Gurugram, police said on Friday. The owner claimed that the dog used to stray sometimes and the neighbour had threatened to kill the dog. "I've also handed over a packet of poisonous substance that was recovered," owner added.

398.title: Deepak Chahar ruled out of ODI series against South Africa
398.article_body: Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar has been ruled out of the ongoing ODI series against South Africa due to stiffness in his back. Earlier, Chahar had missed six months of cricket from February to August due to injuries. All-rounder Washington Sundar, who last played an ODI in February, has been named as Chahar's replacement.

399.title: 50 bricks made of 50.23 kg cocaine worth ₹502 cr seized in Navi Mumbai
399.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 50 bricks made of 50.23 kilograms of cocaine worth ₹502 crore at a Navi Mumbai port. The bricks were inside a container carrying fruits. "This container was brought to India by the same importer...arrested in the case involving the seizure of 198 kilograms of meth and 9 kilograms of cocaine...earlier this week," DRI said.

400.title: Samson, Kishan don't have the X-factor that Pant has: Saba Karim
400.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim said Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan don't have the X-factor that Rishabh Pant possesses. "Pant [is] my first-choice in...white-ball and red-ball cricket," added Karim. "Kishan hasn't made the most of his chances which is why he's fallen down the pecking order...Samson's return to the main team will happen as a batter, not as a wicketkeeper," he stated.

401.title: Tharoor denies rumours claiming he withdrew from Congress President poll
401.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said that he is "surprised" by calls saying that "rumours from Delhi sources" claimed that he has withdrawn from the party's presidential election. While denying the claims in a video message, he added, "Let me assure you that I don't withdraw from a challenge. Never have all my life and never will."

402.title: Registered labourers in Pune to get ₹4.75 lakh under housing scheme: Maha govt
402.article_body: Maharashtra government would provide financial support of ₹4.75 lakh to registered labourers in Pune under housing scheme, Minister of Labour Suresh Khade said. "The...labourers had to undergo...hardships during...pandemic. Considering that, efforts are being made...to provide [them] homes," he said. The District Collector's office has been told to give information about vacant government lands.

403.title: Identified 250 dengue hotspots in Delhi, will begin door-to-door inspections: MCD
403.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has identified 250 dengue hotspots across the city, where several mosquito breeding sites were found. Special drives, including fogging, sprinkling of larvicides, cleaning of drainage and water bodies etc will be carried out in these areas. The authorities will also carry out door-to-door inspections to check and destroy mosquito breeding sites.

404.title: Flipkart delivery man runs away with 61 gadgets worth ₹4 lakh in B'luru
404.article_body: A Flipkart delivery executive has been booked for allegedly running away with 61 gadgets including iPhones and laptops in Bengaluru last month. The accused, Shaik Babajan, had to deliver the gadgets worth ₹4 lakh in Ganganagar. The operational manager of a logistics company attached to Flipkart said Babajan had been recruited recently. Police have launched a manhunt to catch him.
